intro: Sopubia cana, commonly known as the white thistle, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a spiny stem and leaves with a rough, hairy texture. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to white, and it produces small, dry fruits called achenes. Sopubia cana is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
